articles.title: From chatbots to collaborators: How AI agents are reshaping enterprise work
articles.summary: Anthropic's Scott White explains how AI agents evolved from chatbots to autonomous workers at VentureBeat Transform 2025, cutting enterprise tasks from weeks to minutes.

articles.title: Cato Networks raises $359M in funding for its SASE platform
articles.summary: , a fast-growing networking and cybersecurity startup, today announced that it has closed a $359 million late-stage investment. The Series G funding round was led by Vitruvian Partners and ION Crossover Partners with participation from multiple returning backers.

articles.title: Apple reportedly considers letting Anthropic and OpenAI power Siri
articles.summary: While Siri can already call on ChatGPT for difficult questions, Apple now seems to be exploring a much deeper integration with technology from third-party AI providers.

articles.title: A Super Mario Maker 2 player has cleared an astonishing 1 million levels
articles.summary: Super Mario Maker 2 was released six years ago this past Saturday. While Nintendo didn't do a whole lot to mark the occasion, one of the game's most dedicated players sure did. DSteves hit a remarkable milestone by becoming the first to clear 1 million SMM2 levels.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg announces his AI ‘superintelligence’ super-group
articles.summary: In a memo to Meta staff, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the company’s new “Meta Superintelligence Labs” group that will head up its AI work, Bloomberg reports.

articles.title: The best midrange smartphone for 2025
articles.summary: A great phone doesn’t need to cost a fortune. In 2025, features once exclusive to high-end devices – big batteries, multi-camera arrays, high refresh rate displays and more – have trickled down to more affordable models.

articles.title: Apple Weighs Using Anthropic or OpenAI to Power Siri in Major Reversal
articles.summary: is considering using artificial intelligence technology from Anthropic PBC or OpenAI to power a new version of Siri, sidelining its own in-house models in a potentially blockbuster move aimed at turning around its flailing AI effort.

articles.title: NASA will start livestreaming content on Netflix later this summer
articles.summary: NASA is bringing live NASA+ programming to Netflix. For the uninitiated, NASA+ is the space agency s very own streaming platform. Content will begin showing up later this summer.

articles.title: You can't buy a Switch 2 on Amazon, and third-party sellers may be to blame
articles.summary: It's been getting easier and easier to purchase a Nintendo Switch 2 since launch, but the console is still notably unavailable from Amazon. According to a new report from Bloomberg, Nintendo's frustration with third-party game sales on the platform could be the reason why.

articles.title: Here Is Everyone Mark Zuckerberg Has Hired So Far for Meta’s ‘Superintelligence’ Team
articles.summary: After a poaching frenzy that’s brought in talent from rival firms like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google, Zuckerberg announced a team of nearly two dozen researchers in an internal memo.

articles.title: What happened when Anthropic's Claude AI ran a small shop for a month (spoiler: it got weird)
articles.summary: Despite Claude making simple (and bizarre) errors as manager of a small store, Anthropic still believes AI middle managers are 'on the horizon.

articles.title: US lawmakers allege that OnePlus phones transmit data to Chinese servers without user consent
articles.summary: A pair of US lawmakers have called on the US Department of Commerce to investigate OnePlus over allegations that the company s devices transmit data to Chinese servers without user consent, according to a report by Reuters.

articles.title: Google embraces AI in the classroom with new Gemini tools for educators, chatbots for students, and more
articles.summary: Google will give teachers the ability to create interactive study guides using the AI research tool Notebook LM, along with their classroom materials.

articles.title: Anthropic's Claude stocked a fridge with metal cubes when it was put in charge of a snacks business
articles.summary: If you re worried your local bodega or convivence store may soon be replaced by an AI storefront, you can rest easy — at least for the time being.

articles.title: Roundtables: Inside OpenAI’s Empire with Karen Hao
articles.summary: Recorded on June 30, 2025 AI journalist Karen Hao’s book, Empire of AI: Dreams and Nightmares in Sam Altman s OpenAI, tells the story of OpenAI’s rise to power and its far-reaching impact all over the world.

articles.title: Google expands access to AI tools in the classroom for educators with Gemini
articles.summary: Google LLC today announced a vastly expanded suite of artificial intelligence tools for educators with Gemini in the Classroom, which includes more than 30 features to help teachers spend more time with students.

articles.title: Google is opening its NotebookLM AI tools to students under 18
articles.summary: The new Gemini tab for educators in Google Classroom. Google announced a variety of new features for its Classroom software suite, including free Gemini AI tools for educators and NotebookLM for users under 18 — the first time the tool has been available to minors.

articles.title: AI has 2 billion users, but only 3% pay
articles.summary: AI has racked up a ton of users globally, but new research shows that very little money is being made by new tech that is incredible expensive to operate.

articles.title: Legit Security launches MCP Server to secure AI-generated code
articles.summary: Application security posture management platform startup Legit Security Ltd. today announced the launch of Legit MCP Server, a new feature designed to bring real-time ASPM to artificial intelligence-led software development.

articles.title: BrowserStack launches AI agent suite to automate software testing workflows
articles.summary: Web and mobile testing company BrowserStack Inc. today announced the launch of BrowserStack AI, a suite of artificial intelligence agents designed to automate and enhance every stage of the software testing lifecycle.

articles.title: Microsoft Says Its New AI System Diagnosed Patients 4 Times More Accurately Than Human Doctors
articles.summary: The tech giant poached several top Google researchers to help build a powerful AI tool that can diagnose patients and potentially cut health care costs.

articles.summary: Learn more about expanded access to Google Vids for all education users, and Gemini in Classroom, a new suite of no-cost AI tools available for educators.

articles.summary: A security company has found eight security vulnerabilities that impact hundreds of Brother printer models. The company has released firmware updates to handle seven of these vulnerabilities, but one security flaw cannot be patched.

articles.summary: 21770v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Glaucoma is a leading cause of irreversible blindness, but early detection can significantly improve treatment outcomes. Traditional diagnostic methods are often invasive and require specialized equipment.

articles.title: Efficient Multilingual ASR Finetuning via LoRA Language Experts
articles.summary: 21555v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advancements in deep learning have significantly enhanced multilingual automatic speech recognition (ASR) due to the development of advanced model architectures and available large-scale multilingual datasets.

articles.title: Debunk and Infer: Multimodal Fake News Detection via Diffusion-Generated Evidence and LLM Reasoning

articles.title: FloorPlan-DeepSeek (FPDS): A multimodal approach to floorplan generation using vector-based next room prediction
articles.summary: 21562v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In the architectural design process, floor plan generation is inherently progressive and iterative. However, existing generative models for floor plans are predominantly end-to-end generation that produce an entire pixel-based layout in a single pass.

articles.title: Team QUST at SemEval-2025 Task 10: Evaluating Large Language Models in Multiclass Multi-label Classification of News Entity Framing
articles.summary: 21564v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper describes the participation of QUST_NLP in the SemEval-2025 Task 7. We propose a three-stage retrieval framework specifically designed for fact-checked claim retrieval.

articles.title: Metaのマーク・ザッカーバーグは最も優秀なAIエンジニア＆研究者をまとめた「ザ・リスト」をベースに引き抜きを画策している
articles.summary: Metaのマーク・ザッカーバーグCEOはAI分野で最も才能のあるエンジニアや研究者を集めたリスト、通称「ザ・リスト」をベースに競合他社から優秀な人材の引き抜きを画策しています。このザ・リストの存在について、ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナルが報じました。続きを読む.

articles.title: 適切なライセンスを受けた素材でのみトレーニングされた動画生成AI「Marey」とは？
articles.summary: 生成AIによるコンテンツは、SNSや作品投稿サイトで見ない日がほとんどないほどあふれていますが、著作権の問題や従来のクリエイターの機会を奪う可能性など、商業作品に取り入れるには依然として多くの問題を抱えています。映画監督のブリン・ムーザー氏が立ち上げた製作会社「Asteria」は適切にライセンスされた素材のみで学習された「倫理的な生成AI」である「Marey」を構築しており、その特徴とそれでも存在している問題についてムーザー氏が語っています。続きを読む.

articles.title: Google s carbon emissions went up again as its AI push continues
articles.summary: A Google data center in Mayes County, Oklahoma. Google’s 2025 sustainability report emphasizes that its ambition-based emissions grew 11 percent last year to reach 11. 5 million metric tons of carbon dioxide pollution, marking a 51 percent increase compared to 2019.

articles.title: Google’s Doppl app took off my socks
articles.summary: I just tried on five different outfits in about 10 minutes — or at least my AI lookalike did. That’s all thanks to Doppl, a new app that Google is testing, which I used to create AI-generated clips of myself wearing outfits that I found across the web.

articles.title: Customizable, no-code voice agent automation with GPT-4o
articles.summary: Retell AI is transforming the call center with AI voice automation powered by GPT-4o and GPT-4. Its no-code platform enables businesses to launch natural, real-time voice agents that cut call costs, boost CSAT, and automate customer conversations—without scripts or hold times.

articles.title: Britain’s first ‘space factory’ blasts into orbit on test mission
articles.summary: A British-built manufacturing satellite successfully launched into orbit on its first test mission. Cardiff-based startup Space Forge launched the probe — called ForgeStar-1 — aboard SpaceX’s Transporter-14 rideshare mission from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on Tuesday.

articles.title: Helsinki turns to AI to spot e-scooter crashes before they happen

articles.summary: Europe’s best-funded space tech firm, Isar Aerospace, plans to strengthen the continent’s access to orbital satellites after raising €150mn to expand its launch service.

articles.title: I Let AI Agents Plan My Vacation—and It Wasn't Terrible

PadChest-GR, developed by the University of Alicante with Microsoft Research, has the potential to advance research across the field for years to come.

articles.title: Switzerland leads the world in deep tech investment, report finds
articles.summary: Switzerland pours more of its venture capital into deep tech than any other country, according to new data. The Swiss Deep Tech Report 2025 found that 60% of all Swiss venture funding between 2019 and 2025 went to deep tech — far surpassing any other nation.

articles.title: It’s officially summer, and the grid is stressed

As I’m writing this newsletter, it’s 100 °F (nearly 38 °C) here in New Jersey, and I’m huddled in the smallest room in my apartment with the shades drawn and a single window air conditioner working overtime. Large swaths of the US have seen brutal heat this.

articles.title: Trump’s isolationism can be ‘best thing that happened’ to Europe, says ex-ASML chief
